ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Provides user-friendly tools for calibration in survey sampling. The package is production-oriented, and its interface is inspired by the famous popular macro 'Calmar' for SAS, so that 'Calmar' users can quickly get used to 'icarus'. In addition to calibration (with linear, raking and logit methods), 'icarus' features functions for calibration on tight bounds and penalized calibration.

Provides user-friendly tools for calibration in survey sampling. The package is production-oriented, and its interface is inspired by the famous popular macro 'Calmar' for SAS, so that 'Calmar' users can quickly get used to 'icarus'. In addition to calibration (with linear, raking and logit methods), 'icarus' features functions for calibration on tight bounds and penalized calibration.

name: r-icarus
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.3.3" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-icarus
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/icarus_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/icarus/icarus_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 8db972bfbe0ac1edf49dcc492c0c6023adc2292bc625dcdb88fea51f48745198

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
  run:
    - r-base

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('icarus')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('icarus')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=icarus
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: Provides user-friendly tools for calibration in survey sampling. The package is production-oriented, and its interface is inspired by the famous popular macro 'Calmar' for SAS, so that 'Calmar' users can quickly get used to 'icarus'. In addition to calibration (with linear, raking and logit methods), 'icarus'
    features functions for calibration on tight bounds and penalized calibration.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - FernandezMathieu

# Package: icarus
# Title: Calibrates and Reweights Units in Samples
# Description: Provides user-friendly tools for calibration in survey sampling. The package is production-oriented, and its interface is inspired by the famous popular macro 'Calmar' for SAS, so that 'Calmar' users can quickly get used to 'icarus'. In addition to calibration (with linear, raking and logit methods), 'icarus' features functions for calibration on tight bounds and penalized calibration.

# Authors@R: c(person("Antoine Rebecq", role=c("aut","cre"), email = "antoine.rebecq@m4x.org"))
# Maintainer: Antoine Rebecq <antoine.rebecq@m4x.org>
# Depends: R (>= 3.1.1)
# License: GPL-3
# LazyData: true
# Suggests: testthat, ggplot2, Rglpk, slam, xtable, magrittr
# RoxygenNote: 6.1.1
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2019-08-20 00:05:27 UTC; rharoine
# Author: Antoine Rebecq [aut, cre]
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2019-08-20 05:00:02 UTC
